name: Steak Nachos
author: Lara
summary: We made these up when we were in the mood for nachos but didn't have any ground beef defrosted. These steak nachos turned out so much better than their ground beef counterpart! We'll definitely make nachos this way from now on.
ingredients: 1 pound flat iron steaks, cut into small pieces
1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 (12 ounce) bag tortilla chips, or to taste
directions: Spray a frying pan with cooking spray
Cook and stir steak until barely any pink remains, 5 to 7 minutes
Drain fat from pan; add   to the steak
Let simmer until desired consistency is reached, 3 to 5 minutes
Warm milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat until small bubbles appear along the sides
Melt butter in another medium saucepan over medium-high heat
Cook, stirring constantly with a whisk, until mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, about 5 minutes
Gradually whisk in the warm milk and bring to a simmer over medium heat
Cook and stir until the mixture is thick and smooth, 10 to 15 minutes
Reduce heat to low and stir in shredded cheese
Add black beans, salsa, and the steak pieces
Stir and serve with tortilla chips
